France's greenhouse gas emissions stopped declining in the first quarter of 2025
description: Carbon emission rates stayed almost flat (+0.2%) from January to March and are set to drop by only 0.8% over 2025, according to the CITEPA nonprofit tasked with calculating emissions. This pace falls far short of climate targets.

French air traffic controllers' strike intensifies, 40% of flights canceled at Paris airports
description: Tens of thousands of passengers had to rearrange their plans as widespread disruption continued in airports across France on Friday, the second day of a strike by air traffic controllers demanding better working conditions.

headline: Mineral water scandal: Nestlé says it removed illegal filters, but must still prove Perrier is pure
description: Nestlé claimed it complied with the law by removing filtration devices at its southern France site, but has not yet provided evidence that Perrier springs can produce water that meets the natural mineral water criteria.

headline: Corsican mafia undergoing 'major recomposition,' intelligence report says
description: According to French crime investigators, new power balances are emerging between two blocs on the Mediterranean island: the Petit Bar gang and the Mattei clan, which is uniting groups from various regions.

headline: Since October 7, more Jewish families in the Paris region 'want to move to a place they perceive as safer'
description: The rise in anti-Semitism has accelerated the ongoing shift in where Jews live in Paris and its suburbs, home to about half of France's estimated 500,000 Jews.

Art weaves a thread between Paris and the Ukrainian front line
description: French-based painter Polina Moroz asked a compatriot, an embroiderer mobilized in the Ukrainian army, to contribute to her canvases. These odes to summer and peace are now on display in Marseille.

headline: Champagne bubbles with excitement for 10th anniversary of its UNESCO designation
description: While bottle sales declined in 2024, especially abroad, the region has opened its hillsides, Champagne houses and cellars to visitors since 2015, sparking a tourism boom.

headline: Water shortages in the upper Indian Himalayas are causing 'villages to die out and traditions to disappear'
description: 'The Himalayas Overheating'  (4/6). Zanskar, located in the Ladakh region of India's mountain highlands, has felt the full force of glacier retreat. With no access to water, villagers have been abandoning their homes and traditional way of life.
